Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure wearing a helmet (or goddess wearing Corithian helmet - Athena?) or other headdress. Mould-made and hollow. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions. Head only.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Published by Gutch (1899, no.111). Parallels dated Late 3rd century BC (Török 1995, nos. 216) and from 3rd century BC Tell Atrib (Szymańska 2005, no. 194). 'Roman' period parallels dated to the 2nd century AD (Bayer Niemeier 1988, 389) and the 2nd to 3rd century AD (Dunand 1990, no. 25). Bayer Niemeier , E. 1988, Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann / Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik Frankfurt am Main I. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten, Melsungen. Dunand, F. 1990. Catalogue des Terres cuites gréco-romaines d’Egypte. Musée du louvre. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Paris. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout. Török, L. 1995, Hellenistic and Roman Terracottas from Egypt, Roma.
Bibliographic references: Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 84, no. 111)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.226) (Phase 3)
